content.text: * Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
* Faculty conducting the course: Management Information Systems, Room 13.11, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334; 6324)
* Meeting hour: 8AM – 11AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.08, Building A1, National Economics University

The Resolution of the Government of Vietnam on the development of the software industry into a spearhead economic sector of the country has made the study and teaching software engineering module has a very important role in the program training sector management information systems and computer science

Engineering software modules equip students with the basic knowledge of the design process from identifying software requirements analysis, design, programming and ultimately deployment. The module also presents the basic content of a project management software and the software production process at industrial scale
[1] Han Viet Thuan (2021). Software Engineering, National Economics University Publishing House.

cells: Students understand and apply basic knowledge of programming and databases; Understand and apply the basic principles of the software development process.

column_map.Goals Description: Students understand and apply basic knowledge of programming and databases; Understand and apply the basic principles of the software development process.

cells: Students have written communication skills; Write reports and make professional presentations related to plans, strategies and implementation of assigned activities; Have communication skills in the online environment. Students have the ability to program, build databases and apply basic principles of software development process; Able to master technologies and techniques to develop, operate and manage information systems to serve operational, management and administrative activities in organizations and businesses; Able to exploit specialized software to analyze data and synthesize information to support the decision-making process; Able to manage information system projects.

column_map.Goals Description: Students have written communication skills; Write reports and make professional presentations related to plans, strategies and implementation of assigned activities; Have communication skills in the online environment. Students have the ability to program, build databases and apply basic principles of software development process; Able to master technologies and techniques to develop, operate and manage information systems to serve operational, management and administrative activities in organizations and businesses; Able to exploit specialized software to analyze data and synthesize information to support the decision-making process; Able to manage information system projects.

cells: Have the ability to work independently or participate in teams; have appropriate attitude and behavior related to safety and ethical standards in the field of information systems.

column_map.Goals Description: Have the ability to work independently or participate in teams; have appropriate attitude and behavior related to safety and ethical standards in the field of information systems.

content.text: Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).

Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.

Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.

full_text:
* Title: Software Engineering
* Code: TIHT1104
* Credits: 3 (45 hours)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs
+ Exercises on class: 10 hrs
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs
+ Self-study: 60 hrs.
* Parallel course(s): None
* Prerequisite course(s):
* Faculty conducting the course: Management Information Systems, Room 13.11, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334; 6324)
+ Lecturers:
1. Nguyen Anh Phuong, Master
Tel: 0987538333 Email: phuongna@neu.edu.vn
2. Trinh Hoai Son, PhD
Tel: 0949127888 Email: sonth@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hour: 8AM – 11AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.08, Building A1, National Economics University
The Resolution of the Government of Vietnam on the development of the software industry into a spearhead economic sector of the country has made the study and teaching software engineering module has a very important role in the program training sector management information systems and computer science
Engineering software modules equip students with the basic knowledge of the design process from identifying software requirements analysis, design, programming and ultimately deployment. The module also presents the basic content of a project management software and the software production process at industrial scale
* Text Books/Lecture Notes:
[1] Han Viet Thuan (2021). Software Engineering, National Economics University Publishing House.
Table 4. Course goals
Table 5. Course learning outcomes (CLOs)
Table 6. Assessment summary
Table 7. Course outline
Table 8.1. Lesson plan for the course
Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
